variant.title: Computational Linguistics and Linguistics: What keeps them together, what sets them apart?
variant.author: Gregor Erbach
variant.bodyText: I will try to position the fields of Linguis- tics and Computational Linguistics by ex- amining their objects of research, their objectives, approaches, and success crite- ria, drawing on the concepts shown in the text cloud below. This should give a clearer view of the commonalities, differ- ences and potential synergies.
variant.footnote: 1 generated with Jonathan Feinberg's Wordle (IBM Research Visual Communication Lab)
variant.note: Proceedings of the EACL 2009 Workshop on the Interaction between Linguistics and Computational Linguistics, page 40, Athens, Greece, 30 March, 2009. cï¿½2009 Association for Computational Linguistics

variant.title: Computational Linguistics and What keeps them together, what sets them apart?
variant.author: Gregor
variant.abstract: I will try to position the fields of Linguistics and Computational Linguistics by examining their objects of research, their objectives, approaches, and success criteria, drawing on the concepts shown in the text cloud below. This should give a clearer view of the commonalities, differences and potential synergies.
variant.note: Concept 1generated with Jonathan Feinberg's Wordle (IBM Research Visual Communication Lab) of the EACL 2009 Workshop on the Interaction between Linguistics and Computational page Greece, 30 March, 2009. Association for Computational Linguistics 40
